author: Staff Reporter
text:
World Tuberculosis (TB) Day was observed in Thoothukudi district on Thursday. In a bid to raise awareness of the ill-effects of TB, a seminar was organised at St. Joseph’s Higher Secondary School in Kovilpatti by Barathiyar Memorial Trust.

While addressing the students, G. Ramamurthy, doctor attached to Kovilpatti urban health centre, said that TB was a contagious disease, which could be cured, if diagnosed earlier. People should not spit at public places and cover their mouth while coughing to prevent spread of TB.

Students should create awareness of the impact of TB, he said.

Handbooks containing information on TB symptoms and preventive steps were given to the participants.

M. Alexshan, Headmistress, presided over the programme. Earlier, P. Muthumurugan, founder of the trust, welcomed the gathering.

According to a statement from Collector M. Ravikumar, over the last 15 years, after the launch of Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme (RNTCP) in the district, 1,93,565 people were sputum-tested for TB, 30,902 patients were diagnosed with TB and 85 per cent of them had been cured of the disease. Last year, 18,565 persons were examined and 1,902 TB patients were identified.
title: World Tuberculosis Day observed
